comments.body:
> @daall , is this needed for 202012?

We should take it, yes. Label added
Which FRR behaviour change is it that causes fpmsyncd to update default route? What did this behaviour break?

After some investigation, I figured that the problem is actually introduced by [this change](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/blob/master/src/sonic-frr/patch/0003-Use-vrf_id-for-vrf-not-tabled_id.patch). SONiC uses `rtm_table` field (which is designed to pass table ID) of netlink_route protocol to pass VRF ID to FPM, and table ID info is lost. Generally there should be only table `main` in the default VRF, so this is harmless. But in fact zebra allows multiple route tables per VRF (or at least the main VRF). This leads to a mix of default VRF route updates across all tables and leaves a broken APPL_DB ROUTE_TABLE.

See `other_tables` field in `struct zebra_vrf`: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-frr/blob/frr/7.5/zebra/zebra_vrf.h#L85

> After some investigation, I figured that the problem is actually introduced by [this change](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/blob/master/src/sonic-frr/patch/0003-Use-vrf_id-for-vrf-not-tabled_id.patch). SONiC uses `rtm_table` field (which is designed to pass table ID) of netlink_route protocol to pass VRF ID to FPM, and table ID info is lost. Generally there should be only table `main` in the default VRF, so this is harmless. But in fact zebra allows multiple route tables per VRF (or at least the main VRF). This leads to a mix of default VRF route updates across all tables and leaves a broken APPL_DB ROUTE_TABLE.
> 
> See `other_tables` field in `struct zebra_vrf`: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-frr/blob/frr/7.5/zebra/zebra_vrf.h#L85

@imzyxwvu Thanks for your investigation. I still have some trouble understanding how `other_tables` leads to this behavior. And it seems that this patch is basically reverting the changes in https://github.com/FRRouting/frr/commit/6dfcd75461ff35ebf89e86f64fe6e982ed09b3e3

> @imzyxwvu Thanks for your investigation. I still have some trouble understanding how `other_tables` leads to this behavior. And it seems that this patch is basically reverting the changes in [FRRouting/frr@6dfcd75](https://github.com/FRRouting/frr/commit/6dfcd75461ff35ebf89e86f64fe6e982ed09b3e3)

I'd suggest you to have a look at `zebra_vrf_lookup_table_with_table_id`.

https://github.com/Azure/sonic-frr/blob/frr/7.5/zebra/zebra_vrf.c#L361

This function includes a lookup on `other_tables`. The comment also contains some information on `table_id`.

-
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2FAzure%2Fsonic-swss%2Fpull%2F1575%23issuecomment-754350619&data=04%7C01%7Cmadhan%40nvidia.com%7C6e40d63cd4b54feabb5808d8b123b15c%7C43083d15727340c1b7db39efd9ccc17a%7C0%7C0%7C637454114153619884%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=cDUbG201fxv0aa%2FXmGRbByqkjC%2FisZ4LHMM0YD26gz0%3D&reserved=0>, or unsubscribe<https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fnotifications%2Funsubscribe-auth%2FAO4Q5FAYSQAB4PASQGGFCT3SYJ4E3ANCNFSM4VO7ESCQ&data=04%7C01%7Cmadhan%40nvidia.com%7C6e40d63cd4b54feabb5808d8b123b15c%7C43083d15727340c1b7db39efd9ccc17a%7C0%7C0%7C637454114153624871%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=vMGnS4ESqPWKnnXJAOxai46HddbOhgwb2zZYvhadcwA%3D&reserved=0>.

This fix is required only in 201911 branch, since the FDB flush implementation is very limited in 201911. In master branch, FdbOrch::updateVlanMember() function is also calling flushFDBEntries(), so we are not seeing this issue in master branch. So, this fix is also not required in master branch.
@prsunny how can we run the LGTM again? or we can merge regardless of the failure?
Can you also validate on the lag parent port case?

> Can you also validate on the lag parent port case?

@wendani I've validated this case. 
**Steps for validation:**
1. Deploy t0 topology.
2. Deploy minigrapgh on DUT
3. Remove member port from Vlan1000 on the DUT
```
config vlan member del 1000 Ethernet8
```
4. Create portchannel on the DUT
```
config portchannel add PortChannel5 --fallback=true
```
5. Add member port to portchannel on the DUT
```
config portchannel member add PortChannel5 Ethernet8
```
6. Setup bond interface on the PTF
```
ip link add bond2 type bond
ip link set bond2 type bond miimon 100 mode balance-xor
ip link set eth2 down
ip link set eth2 master bond2
ip link set dev bond2 up
ifconfig bond2 hw ether 22:22:22:22:22:21
ifconfig bond2 mtu 9216 up
```
7. Setup configuration of sub-ports on the DUT
**_sub_port_config.j2_:**
```
{
	"VLAN_SUB_INTERFACE": {

		"PortChannel5.10": {
			"admin_status" : "up"
		},
		"PortChannel5.10|172.16.0.5/30": {}
	}
}
```
```
sonic-cfggen -j sub_port_config.j2 --write-to-db
```
8. Setup configuration of sub-ports on the PTF
```
ip link add link bond2 name bond2.10 type vlan id 10
ip address add 172.16.0.6/30 dev bond2.10
ip link set bond2.10 up
```
9. Ping DUT from PTF
``` 
ping -I bond2.10 172.16.0.5
```
**Validation results**
```
/# ping -I bond2.10 172.16.0.5
PING 172.16.0.5 (172.16.0.5) from 172.16.0.6 bond2.10: 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from 172.16.0.5: icmp_seq=1 ttl=64 time=0.405 ms
64 bytes from 172.16.0.5: icmp_seq=2 ttl=64 time=0.445 ms
64 bytes from 172.16.0.5: icmp_seq=3 ttl=64 time=0.771 ms
64 bytes from 172.16.0.5: icmp_seq=4 ttl=64 time=0.746 ms
```
```
~$ tcpdump -nei PortChannel5.10
tcpdump: verbose output suppressed, use -v or -vv for full protocol decode
listening on PortChannel5.10, link-type EN10MB (Ethernet), capture size 262144 bytes
14:55:19.045230 22:22:22:22:22:21 > 74:83:ef:c9:b4:38, ethertype IPv4 (0x0800), length 98: 172.16.0.6 > 172.16.0.5: ICMP echo request, id 911, seq 1862, length 64
14:55:19.045305 74:83:ef:c9:b4:38 > 22:22:22:22:22:21, ethertype IPv4 (0x0800), length 98: 172.16.0.5 > 172.16.0.6: ICMP echo reply, id 911, seq 1862, length 64
14:55:20.069271 22:22:22:22:22:21 > 74:83:ef:c9:b4:38, ethertype IPv4 (0x0800), length 98: 172.16.0.6 > 172.16.0.5: ICMP echo request, id 911, seq 1863, length 64
14:55:20.069359 74:83:ef:c9:b4:38 > 22:22:22:22:22:21, ethertype IPv4 (0x0800), length 98: 172.16.0.5 > 172.16.0.6: ICMP echo reply, id 911, seq 1863, length 64
14:55:21.093466 22:22:22:22:22:21 > 74:83:ef:c9:b4:38, ethertype IPv4 (0x0800), length 98: 172.16.0.6 > 172.16.0.5: ICMP echo request, id 911, seq 1864, length 64
14:55:21.093536 74:83:ef:c9:b4:38 > 22:22:22:22:22:21, ethertype IPv4 (0x0800), length 98: 172.16.0.5 > 172.16.0.6: ICMP echo reply, id 911, seq 1864, length 64
```

comments.body: Question: How is the Config Db being updated ?

> Question: How is the Config Db being updated ?

Right now, we have two method to update the config DB.
1. directly to edit the `/etc/sonic/config_db.json` and execute `sudo config reload -y`
2. To use `redis-cli` to update the config db.

In the future, we would like to provide some CLI tool to update the MACsec state.
In the code, is there process to check all the instances alive and restart it when it's dead/killed?

can you point out the global neighbor table test added? I cannot find it somehow.

> can you point out the global neighbor table test added? I cannot find it somehow.

I have not added neighbor test case yet since the existing virtual chassis test setup does not have front panel neighbor yet. I can create a static neighbor on a front panel port and test for syncing and records in ASIC DB.

> I can create a static neighbor on a front panel port and test for syncing and records in ASIC DB.

@vganesan-nokia that will be good.

> 
> 
> > I can create a static neighbor on a front panel port and test for syncing and records in ASIC DB.
> 
> @vganesan-nokia that will be good.

Added vs test case (commit https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/1431/commits/233a1bedc8d6a5177cf4050d658551c47d52cda0) for testing neighbor programming with encap index and syncing to chassis app db. This requires sairedis PR https://github.com/Azure/sonic-sairedis/pull/725. Please note that testing for **remote** neigh programming is TODO since remote neigh processing requires inband interface setup which is not available in this PR #1431. This test will be enhanced in the  inband interface implementation PR.

> Can we use dvs.add_neighbor() ?

The thinking behind adding neighbor directly to kernel is to simulate a situation of a host attached to a front panel port. This is close to the setup of an eBGP neighbor attached to the front panel port. dvs.add_neighbor() injects the neighbor entry directly to the app db, which is couple of steps later in the host learning process. I think it is better have a neighbor statically configured directly to the kernel so that we can test local neighbor processing as close as to a real situation.

> > Can we use dvs.add_neighbor() ?
> 
> The thinking behind adding neighbor directly to kernel is to simulate a situation of a host attached to a front panel port. This is close to the setup of an eBGP neighbor attached to the front panel port. dvs.add_neighbor() injects the neighbor entry directly to the app db, which is couple of steps later in the neighbor add process. I think it is better have a neighbor statically configured directly to the kernel so that we can test local neighbor processing as close as to a real situation.

vs test fails because of sonic-sairedis PR https://github.com/Azure/sonic-sairedis/pull/737, which introduced the fabric port creation in voq switch create. It seems we create fabric port for both NPU asic and fabric asic. But in this PR #1431 we do not have support to supply fabric port lane mapping in line cards in vs tests (test_virtual_chassis.py). Without fabriclanemap.ini info switch create fails and orchagent crashes. 

To fix this: 
    (1) We need the sonic-buildimage PR https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/6185 and some changes in sonic-swss/tests to get fabric port lane mapping file or 
    (2) Temporarily comment out fabric port creation code for now to enable merging PR #1431 

@lguohan, @ngoc-do, @eswaranb any other suggestions to address this?

> vs test fails because of sonic-sairedis PR [Azure/sonic-sairedis#737](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-sairedis/pull/737), which introduced the fabric port creation in voq switch create. It seems we create fabric port for both NPU asic and fabric asic. But in this PR #1431 we do not have support to supply fabric port lane mapping in line cards in vs tests (test_virtual_chassis.py). Without fabriclanemap.ini info switch create fails and orchagent crashes.
> 
> To fix this:
> (1) We need the sonic-buildimage PR [Azure/sonic-buildimage#6185](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/6185) and some changes in sonic-swss/tests to get fabric port lane mapping file or
> (2) Temporarily comment out fabric port creation code for now to enable merging PR #1431
> 
> @lguohan, @ngoc-do, @eswaranb any other suggestions to address this?

Oh, that's right. Sorry, https://github.com/Azure/sonic-sairedis/pull/737 is blocking you now.

Yes, to fix it, seems option 2 is faster for you. I made this https://github.com/Azure/sonic-sairedis/pull/769. Hope it will remove the blocker. Of course, we won't merge https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/6185 until this PR merges.

> 
> 
> > vs test fails because of sonic-sairedis PR [Azure/sonic-sairedis#737](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-sairedis/pull/737), which introduced the fabric port creation in voq switch create. It seems we create fabric port for both NPU asic and fabric asic. But in this PR #1431 we do not have support to supply fabric port lane mapping in line cards in vs tests (test_virtual_chassis.py). Without fabriclanemap.ini info switch create fails and orchagent crashes.
> > To fix this:
> > (1) We need the sonic-buildimage PR [Azure/sonic-buildimage#6185](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/6185) and some changes in sonic-swss/tests to get fabric port lane mapping file or
> > (2) Temporarily comment out fabric port creation code for now to enable merging PR #1431
> > @lguohan, @ngoc-do, @eswaranb any other suggestions to address this?
> 
> Oh, that's right. Sorry, [Azure/sonic-sairedis#737](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-sairedis/pull/737) is blocking you now.
> 
> Yes, to fix it, seems option 2 is faster for you. I made this [Azure/sonic-sairedis#769](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-sairedis/pull/769). Hope it will remove the blocker. Of course, we won't merge [Azure/sonic-buildimage#6185](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/6185) until this PR merges.

Thanks for fixing

reviews.body: need to add swss vs tests
The latest revision of  VOQ test looks good to me.
Had a few more minor formatting suggestions for the test
